question: You arranged to visit a friend in Canada but an important event at home now means that you must change the dates of the visit.Write a letter to your friend. In your letterexplain the important eventapologise for the situationsuggest a new arrangement
text: Remember we scratched out my trip to Canada a few weeks ago? I was planning to swing by to you and spend with your family and you a couple of days. Unfortunately, I have to hold off on the travel because of some issues at my work.

The point is that the project that I am accounting for started slowing down and there is a huge possibility that we will not be able to roll out our part of the software before the deadline. I have already pulled out all the stops  but seems like it is not enough. The bottom line is my team is suffering from a lack of experience, so I will need to put in some extra time and cancel all of my personal activities.

I am really sorry if you need to adjust your plans because of all of this. However, I hope that I will deal with all of the occurred problems by the end of the next month. If it works for you, let's shift our meeting to the beginning of August.
Please let me know if there are some other obstacles I am not aware of.
